title: Tensions rise as Husam Musa attends PAS ceramah - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Tuesday, 21 February 2017 | MYT 2:53 PM Tensions rise as Husam Musa attends PAS ceramah by syed azhar 
KOTA BARU: Former PAS leader Datuk Husam Musa did the unthinkable - he gatecrashed a ceramah that was organised by the state PAS Youth to humiliate him for his attacks on the party. 
The ceramah, titled " Husam lari dari debat baiáh (Husam running away from oath of loyalty debate)", was held outside the Sultan Muhammad IV Stadium on Monday night. 
The ceramah centred on allegations made by Husam, who is Salor assmblyman, that PAS received RM90mil from Umno. 
Husam surprised everyone when he arrived at the ceramah alone at about 11pm. He walked up to the stage and sat with PAS leaders behind the invited speakers, who included Kelantan PAS information chief and exco member Datuk Nasurudin Daud and Keterah PAS chief Wan Ismail Wan Jusoh. 
While Nasurudin was speaking, a member of the audience appeared at the side of the stage and challenged Husam to debate on the issue. 
The situation quickly turned into a shouting match between Parti Amanah Negara supporters of Husam and those from PAS. 
It was only after security guards urged Husam to leave the stage that the situation returned to normal. 
Husam, who saw the tense situation, left the stage but mingled with the crowd while Nasurudin continued with his attacks. 
Nasurudin claimed that Husam had sent him three letters to debate on the baiáh issue since November last year but nothing materialised. 
Husam then proceeded to a shop in front of Kota Darul Naim (the state government complex) where he explained that he was invited to the ceramah by a member of the organising committee. 
"I was invited to the ceramah and that was why I came in the hope of debating with Nasurudin. 
"When I sat on the stage I asked PAS Youth information chief Nazman Che Ibrahim if I could be given five minutes to speak. 
"Nazman told me that Nasurudin denied my request," he told the Amanah supporters. 
Husam said Kelantan PAS, especially Nasurudin, was unprofessional and should apologise to him for using his name in a contentious issue. 
The baiáh issue is a matter of debate among PAS leaders who had defected. 
They had sworn that if they were to violate the oath, it will result in divorce from their wives. 
Kuala Krai MP Dr Mohd Hatta Ramli and Tumpat MP Datuk Kamaruddin Jaafar, who won on PAS tickets in the last general election, are said to have violated the oath, which was introduced by the late Kelantan Mentri Besar Datuk Nik Abdul Aziz Nik Mat in 2004 to stop defections. Related Stories
